revised_title: Investigating Blood Pressure and Blood Volume Changes in Human Operations
tldr: This study investigates changes in blood pressure and blood volume in wounded men undergoing operations. The author measures systolic and diastolic blood pressures and estimates blood volume using the Riva Rocci method and Haldane's method. The results show a relationship between blood pressure and blood volume changes, and the author proposes a formula to explain this interdependence. The study also discusses the effects of nitrous oxide and oxygen anesthesia on blood concentration and the role of venous tone in circulation.
